content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: ETCD
      operator: not_equal_to
      value: UNPLAN
    - name: ETCD
      operator: is_not_contained_by
      value: $te_etcd
Core:
  Id: CORE-000173
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Raise an error when ETCD is not equal to 'UNPLAN' and not equal to TE.ETCD
Operations:
  - domain: TE
    id: $te_etcd
    name: ETCD
    operator: distinct
Outcome:
  Message: ETCD is not equal to 'UNPLAN' and not equal to TE.ETCD
  Output Variables:
    - ETCD
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0414
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The Subject Elements domain allows the submission
                  of data on the timing of the trial Elements a subject actually passed
                  through in their participation in the trial. Read Section 7.2.2,
                  Trial Elements, on the Trial Elements (TE) dataset and Section 7.2.1,
                  Trial Arms, on the Trial Arms (TA) dataset, as these datasets define
                  a trial's planned Elements and describe the planned sequences of
                  Elements for the Arms of the trial.
                Document: SDTMIG V3.4
                Item: Assumptions
                Section: '5.3'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - SPECIAL-PURPOSE
      - TRIAL DESIGN
  Domains:
    Include:
      - SE
      - TA

json.Description: Raise an error when ETCD is not equal to 'UNPLAN' and not equal to TE.ETCD

Outcome.Message: ETCD is not equal to 'UNPLAN' and not equal to TE.ETCD

Citations.Cited_Guidance: The Subject Elements domain allows the submission of data on the timing of the trial Elements a subject actually passed through in their participation in the trial. Read Section 7.2.2, Trial Elements, on the Trial Elements (TE) dataset and Section 7.2.1, Trial Arms, on the Trial Arms (TA) dataset, as these datasets define a trial's planned Elements and describe the planned sequences of Elements for the Arms of the trial.
